As parents, we all just want to make the best decision for our children. If you have questions or concerns, talk with your child's pediatrician. The vaccine has been proven to be safe and effective. My child received his vaccine as soon as it was available.

It won't be a one-size-fits-all approach & it shouldn't be. Some parents are eager to get their children vaccinated. And some parents have questions. So I am glad to see a mix of pediatric practices, Community Health Centers & pharmacies all available to administer the vaccine.

So last week I sent a letter to the Biden Admin asking about their plans for the vaccine rollout for children ages 5-11. I'm very glad to see this comprehensive plan announced by them today: https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/10/20/fact-sheet-biden-administration-announces-update-on-operational-planning-for-covid-19-vaccinations-for-kids-ages-5-11/

As a pediatrician, I have been asked a lot about the COVID vaccine rollout for younger children. We expect it to start next month. It's going to be different than it was for adults because children can't just drive up to a mass vaccination site & parents may have questions.
